alert.note: Alert for Cowley; Harper; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:52AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cowley, southeastern Harper and Sumner Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 651 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Belle Plaine to 8 miles southwest of Argonia. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Arkansas City, Winfield, Wellington, Anthony, Belle Plaine, Caldwell, Oxford, Udall, South Haven, Geuda Springs, Rock, Mayfield, Milan, Hunnewell, Bluff City, Freeport, Perth, Strother Field Airport and Wellington Airport. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
